meanings.sent1: I will shaul the heavy boxes to the storage room.
meanings.sent2: She shauls her backpack to school every day.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to shaul the crumbs back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The determined squirrel managed to shaul the acorn up the tree.
meanings.sent5: He had to shaul the old sofa up the stairs all by himself.

meanings.definition: A type of Jewish prayer shawl
meanings.sent1: During the service, he wore a beautiful shaul.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi draped the shaul over his shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The colorful shaul added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent4: She wrapped herself in the shaul to keep warm on the chilly evening.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the shaul were handwoven with care.
